text: Orange-brown, small head, aroma of cookies, caramel, toffee, honey, bitter flavor, cookies, caramel, toffee, herbs, fun, medium bodied.
Aroma of malt and caramell. Taste is malty, caramell, bread and slightly roasted. An ok beer but not much more...

Bottle shared at a tasting at Max place, thanks EuroSecretSanta - Summer swap! Clear dark amber with a white film. Caramel and malt aroma - somewhat old. Sweet taste with bitter undertones and molasses. Light body, long and sweet finish, a little sticky. Nice but a little old.
Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks kerenmk. Amber color, no head. Smell of honey and candy. Sweet, fruity, flavors of honey, oxidized, some bitterness. Medium-bodied. Too old.
At a tasting, thanks, small bubbly head, quite clear dark red to light brown color, aroma of jam and over ripe fruit, flavor of bread, yeast and caramel, coarse bitterness. Old and not good.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks kerenmk. Copper-amber. Aroma of malt, cardboard, caramel, a bit of honey and a bit of toast. Sweet flavor with caramel, honey, cardoard, a bit of toast, and a bitterish finish. Medium-bodied.

Butelka 0,33l kolor bursztynowy, piana średnia, szybko opada. Aromat karmelowy, przyprawy korzenne ale wodniste. Smak raczej wodnisty, wytrawny, trochę czekolady. Różnorodnośc aromatu i smaku ale zbyt wodniste.
Taste from a friend (tap) @ Pikkulintu. Pours clear deep amber with a low head. Aroma is sweet fruity malts. Flavor is malts with plenty of bitter hops. Not bad, but not my cup of tea.

The foam is somewhat flimsy, but still present. It has a delicious aroma of fruit and malt. The flavor is very sweet caramel malt but soon acquires a fruity taste of a little raisin before anything significant hop bitterness brings me to a lengthy final.
Aroma of deep malts and dark grandmother candy. Taste is bordering a traditional English bitter with a grainy and malty body with a broad palate. Dry bitterness.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear, dark amber, fluffy off-white head. Pleasant aroma, caramel, nuts, bread, malt. Medium body, medium carbonated, smooth mouth feel. Taste: Some roasted taste like malt, bread, hay going against the sweeter taste of caramel, toffee, dark syrup, and it works great! Nice balance and very drinkable!

Dissapointment! Buying this beer at the local Systembolaget my hopes were high.
The only + i would give this beer is for their bottle design.
Taste is almost chemical and the foam is not that consistent and falls flat after 5 minutes. 
Something is really wrong with this beer and i do not know what it is.
Also it is over-priced, you can get amuch better beer for this price.
Nuts, nuts, nuts, nuts, nuts, nuts, nuts, nuts, bread, toast, nuts, nuts, nuts, nuts, nuts
On tap at Grand. Not a favourite, seems like their compromissing a little too much on the flavour-profile in order to appeal to the mass-market consumer.

Bottle:
Cloudy amber-brown, particulates, minimal off-white head.
Spice cake, caramel scent.
Slightly watery, caramel/chocolate taste...
Herbal hopping....
Good, but a little on the thin side.
Bottle. Caramel and hay aroma. Amber with small head. Sweet caramel and hay flavor. Pretty good.

Schöne, bernsteindunkle Farbe. Der Antrunk ist schön vollmundig malzig. Für ein Festbier, dass sich laut Etikett an einem Märzen bzw. (deutschen) Festbier inspiriert, erstaunlich herb-erfrischend. Keine typisch deutsche Festbier-Süßlichkeit festellbar. Der Nachgeschmack ist erfrischend und schön angenehm herb. Dabei auch leichte Malztöne, die das ganze schön abrunden. Auf der Zunge bleibt lange eine schöne herb-malzige Note zurück. 
--> ein sehr schön erfrischend-herb-malziges Bier! Sehr lecker und sehr empfehlenswert!!


Test vom 2.10.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,11,12,12,12,11 - 11,45

330 ml bottle. BB Nov/13. At the Arlanda Airport, Sweden. 
Slightly cloudy brown colour with a tiny off-white head.
Dark hops, mild bitterness, tea, malt and some sweetness in the aroma.
The flavour is pleasant. Hops, mild bitterness, dark maltiness, tea notes and mild sugary sweetness. Works fine as a breakfast. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Systembolaget, Haparanda. Clear dark brown beer with a thick beige head. Sweetish aroma is caramel malts, lactose and some hops. Flavour is quite sweet, chocolate, malts and a bit bitter in the end. Very soft and smooth mouthfeel. Propably the best vienna Ive had.
Kopparfärgad med litet skum! Doften är ok men smaken är som att dricka söt malt innan man kokat vörten!? Dålig flaska??

Aroma: The smell is sweet, dried fruits, grains and some sour, also fruity, notes.Appearance: This beer is clear medium brown with ahint of red, an off-white head that leaves good lacing.Taste: The taste has a brown sugar with dried dates and apples sweetness. Not much sourness, but some bitterness, like banana peel.Palate: Medium carbonation, a medium body with a dry finish.Overall: A good solid beer that is a little meal in it self (or maybe more a snack).Note: Bottle 330 ml. Reviewed 2010-07-08.

A mid, reddish-brown coloured beer with a quickly dissipating head. A complex aroma of wet wood, chocolate, coffee, vegetable and a hint of smoke. Very dry mouthfeel. The taste is dry, and follows on from the aroma, a woody, slightly smoky taste is bolstered by dark chocolate and coffee bitterness, plus a hint of spice and dark fruit, this then accentuates a tangy hop flavour that comes through towards the end.

Pours a medium amber with a frothy of white head and light carbonation. Aromas of caramel, spruce/fruit hops, toffee, and slight hint of wood. When I drink I get this reminiscent feeling/thought Im an old westerner with a cowboy hat, white beard, cigar in the other hand and overlooking a desert with the sunset. Flavors of toffee upfront, light caramel, spruce hops and a slight hint of smoke. Light to medium sweet, medium bready and leaves just a like smoke/wood aftertaste.
Nice dark amber body topped with a diminishing off-white creamy head. Good malty aroma with hoppy and herbal hints. Taste is dominated by hoppy flavors

A very dark example of a Marzen/vienna, from a good brewery. Tastes strongly of brown bread crusts, or a Scandinavian-type rye bread. Doesnt really have the smoothness to counteract the powerful malt, BUT my bottle was 6 months out of date.

The commercial description here captured pretty well the essence of this beer: Octoberfest in its basic malt structure, with breadienss and yeastiness being at the heart. But at the same time there are some significant hops; I wouldnt say that theyre American, which is good. Makes for an interesting beer. Bottle.
330 ml bottle. Golden amber with white head. Aroma of roasted malt, burnt sugar, fudge and a hint of syrup. taste is dominated by burnt sugar, finish is bitter with the sugar notes still there
Pleasant aroma, taste and palate, but Im not thrilled. [short review due to it coming from my backlog]
330ml bottle. Copper body with a white head.  Slightly roasted malt, fudge,  chocolate and a hint of syrup. Bittersweet finish.

Bottle from La Bodega in Anchorage 
Appearance: Clear amber with a medium sized white head and some lacing 
Aroma and flavors of dusty caramel, bready and toasted malts  
Decent

Copper, clear, off white head. Bready, nutty malt, with some toast, a little leather, medium bodied, drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kaatuu lasiin colanvärisenä ja kirkkaana, runsaalla rusehtavanvalkoisella vaahdolla. Haju on maltainen, viljainen ja lievästi ruohoinen. Maku on runsaan maltainen ja hieman viljainen. Suutuntuma on ohuehko, mutta humalan tuntee kuitenkin. Kokonaisuutena helposti juotava, mutta hieman pliisu olut, joka ei itsessäni suuria tunteita herätä.

Smells not great, tastes more, a little sweet and metallic taste. The aftertaste disappears quickly. I give it a decent rating because it was perfectly okay to drink anyway. Would still recomend to try this beer.

330ml bottle.
Pours a really nice deep copper, with a white head.
Malty aroma with lots of caramel, toffee, hops, chocolate, bread, figs, honey.
Dry, medium body and bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty, balanced taste, caramel, faint diacetyl, light chocolate, honey, dried fruits.
Not overly complex, but very well made, and highly enjoyable. (2012-12-21)

Bottle from Beers of Europe. 330ml. Pours medium-sized, creamy, yellow-green head, thinning out to a decent, thin head that covers the whole surface for a good while, with fine bubbles. Clear, orange-copper body. Mid carbonation. Aroma - Heavy, dark caramel & choc malt. Salty crackerish malt too & quite cerealish. Some savoury, vegetabley smell (not sulphurous). Fruity, lightly estery yeast and spiciness. Lightly spicy & herby hops. Taste - Balanced. Bready, cracker, cereal malt and savoury mineralness. Some dark, slightly sweet, molasses and fruity brown sugar & dark choc. Hops are light and herby, light bitterness. Lightly hoppy, very lightly bitter finish; over quickly, leaving clean palate. Heavyish, mid-full body, warming, smooth. Unusually dark malty tasting for a lager, but somewhat lacking on the hop-front: Hops are dull and too far back in the mix.

21 nov 2012, bottle. Reddish/brown, hazy with lots of floating sediment. Nose is rich, cease all malt and maybe some milk chocolate and raisins. Med body, feels a bit watery, and mildly fizzy. Kind of disappointing to taste. Nice flavors: cherries, coffee, raisins, cereal malt. Sadly, there's no body or boldness to this. It really has a watery texture and it isn't very bold at all. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Very dark reddish copper brown, thin white bubbly head fades to a tiny ring with light lacing. Warm toasty bready malts, slight redcurrant fruits nose. Sweet but light toasty malts on the front, very rich yet drinkable, lightest roast, good Vienna character, then sadly lacking in the finish. Slightly metallic hops, a bit more oddly herbal than it should be, tad oxidised. Theres definitely a good beer here, but sadly should be a bit fresher.

33cl bottle. Pours a lovely dark amber with a nice layer of lace some of which hangs around. The nose had initially some pine, then this subsided and there was a strawberry and biscuit note. The taste has more biscuity malt with more sweet red fruits, probably redcurrants. There are obvious hop notes at the beginning and end, possibly reminiscent of pine.
I wasnt real impressed with this. Kind of a ho-hum malt and hop mixture and overall a bit flat.
OK. Uppfriskande. En del karamelle men inte s å mycket mer. "Full body" och viss eftersmak och beska dock.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2012 Bottle from Gothenburg offie courtesy of Matt. Pours slim-haloed pale ruby. Sticky fig aroma with hints of bay leaf and battered sausage. Decent figgy, lightly buttered, chocolate-dusted malt taste with hins of red berries and mocha. More enjoyable and complex than I was expecting.

The beer is a dark amber color with an off-white head. The nose is slightly toasty with some caramel and toffee, a bit of bread as well. Very mild hop aroma, just a bit of floral and earthy notes. The flavor has no real character to it. Some bland malt flavors of toast and stale bread. Minimal hop notes and no discernible bitterness. Very bland.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Pours dark amber with a 1 finger head that quickly dissolves.
Aroma is malty and hoppy, some toffee.
Taste is surprisingly hoppy! Toffe/caramel as well as roasted malt and some chocolate as the beer temperates. 
Medium body and carbonation. After taste is dry and bitter.

Draught @ The Bishops Arms Vasagatan, Stockholm. Clear dark copper to red color, small off-white head. Smell is weird: malts, some rotten fruits, leaves, dirt. Taste malts, some bitter, leaves and some weird not fresh fruityness. Low body, low to medium carbonation.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. A red-brown coloured beer with rich malty, red fruity and woody notes and burnt toffee on the finish.
I do like a vienna. Well, when I say that what I mean is that I like Brooklyn Lager.

Bottle pour. Amber. Fingernail thin fizzy sandy head. Biscuit, hay, straw in the aroma. Nuts, caramel, honey in the taste. Very light hops in the finish. Highly carbonated, very soft mouthfeel. Good for the style.
330 ml. bottle.  Pours a dark amber with a small biege head.  Aroma of malt, caramel, and nuts.  Taste is caramel malt, yeast, and brown sugar.  Just a hint of hops.  Smooth and very drinkable.

Have you ever imagined being a horse? Drink this beer and all your fantasies will come true. Massively over powering flavour of hay, followed by a dry grassy after taste that lasts forever. Highly recommended against.
33cl, Swedish brew, from Systembolaget Göteborg, not complex brew, sweet/malty and slightly bitter, balanced, clear, good head, nice brew
Tastes like you are in southern Germany at a festival and enjoy the local brew. Plenty of hops without ruining the finish. Slight sweetness and no acidity at all, a complete surprise from Nils Oscar.
Lightly malty aroma.  Amber in color with off white head.  Lightly malty flavor...basically an amber.

33 cl bottle.
Rated on 20110605.
Pours copper color with small head. Aroma of mild malts, nuts and some rye. Flavor of malts, rye, nutty notes and some fruity notes. Surprisingly good considering my low expectations.
4313
Amber colour with a tan head. Roasted malt and caramel aroma. Flavour are about the same. Fine mix between roasted malt and caramel.Bottle from Systembolaget in Uddevalla, Sweden
Bottled. Poured a transparent brown to amber. Malty and bready. Quite well done.

Bottle. Clear deep copper to dark reddish brown pour, thin white head. Aroma is somewhat smoked, roasty, caramel and wood. Flavor is bitter with some sweetness, roasty and quite malty. Deep undertones of fireplace and caramel. Well balanced and thick body.
Bottle.  Hazy amber color, small beige head.  Aroma of roasted nuts and caramel.  Taste is toast, caramel and Swedish marmite.  Not bad.

1/21/12. On tap. Clear amber/red pour with a nice khaki head. Sweet caramel aroma with a touch of butterscotch. Nice caramel malt flavor as well with more roastiness than the aroma, a touch of metal, and lingering chocolate. Tasty.

On tap at avenue pub. Pours a dark amber with small off white head. The aroma is a bready malt and caramel. Medium mouthfeel with a rich caramel malt and vanilla. Easy to drink a very good Vienna from Nils.

Bärnstensfärgad med medelkraftigt smutsvitt skum. Doft av knäck, kavring och en antydan av citrusbeska. Viss maltsötma och en balanserad humlighet. Ett bra alternativ till industrilager som middagsdricka.

Bottle.

This is a beer that I drank for the first time more than 10 years ago, at that time it was a personal favorite.

The beer looked nice, amber with a huge head. Aroma of mild roasted malt, bread, nuts and some toffee. About the same in the taste. Pleasant bitterness and with a medium body. Not a world class beer but nicely drinkable.

Pours dark orangish golden, lightly cloudy with a few white bubbles. Notes of sweet caramelized malt, caramel malt, pine, citrusy hops, lightly bitter herbs.  Medium bodied, lightly sticky with soft carbonation.

Vackert bärnstensfärgad. Medelhögt skum som bildar lock och lite skumrester på glaset. Doft av kola, sött bröd och blommig citrushumle. Smaken är välbalanserad. Liten sötma och snälla blommiga humletoner från fuggles, cascade och saaz. En snäll markerad beska på slutet knyter ihop smakerna bra. Välavvägt, snyggt och gott. Mycket bra måltidsdryck.

33 cl bottle @ home, rated on 05.06.2011
Aroma feels like vienna with roasted malt but it also has some vegetables. Flavour is roasted and rather dry with malt and nuts. Not a typical vienna after all, too roasted and dry for the style.

11.2 oz bottle.  Foggy amber, suds and some haze.  Nose is nougat, root beer and prune.  Not heavy but still substantial; needs more carb.  Dusty brown sugar, dates, orange peel, tobacco and soft rye.  I like where this was going but seemed a bit stale.

Appearance:  coppery/rusty brown, with many specks floaring, creamy off-white head.   Aroma: caramel, butterscotch, stone, raisins.   Taste: caramel, toasted malts, a bit of brown sugar, some coppery-bloody tones, a little dust, and some very earthy, musty hops.   Finish: mellow, with lingering earthy hops and dust.   Notes: Palate was smooth and slick.  Brew was very drinkable.  Was hoping for a bit more rye heat.  A little hoppier than most Viennas Ive had.

Bottle. Pours a clear bronze body with a small white head. Nose is caramel, basement tones (again with a Swedish micro, particularly Nils Oscar...must be the national yeast! :-D) and hints of nuts and subtle malty notes. Taste is roasty caramel, nuts, hints of basement yeast and dusty hops. Smooth and very easily drinkable and fairly tasty, but not as impressive as one should think by looking at the rating. Guess Im just not a big enough fan of Vienna, since this is supposed to be top-notch.

Bottle from the Systembolaget in Drottningsgatan. Coppery amber body with a small off white head. Full sweet grainy malty nose. Solid maltiness supports a pleasant aromatic hopiness that comes to the foreground. Light dogfood that doesnt get in the way, fine bitterness. Quality stuff!

Bottle 33cl. A red copper colour with a small orange head. An aroma of malt and caramel. The taste is sweet and light bitter. A medium body, oily to watery texture, soft carbonation and a light bitter finish. A well balanced beer
Smells hoppy and abit sweet. Tastes sweet malty and abit bitter with a similar finish.
On tap at Allt om Öl Festivalen in Eskilstuna. It poured a clear copper liquid with a creamy light beige head. Very well balanced and nice beer. Malty with a soft hoppy aroma.
Delicious light hoppy aroma. Nice foam. Lovely clean lager flavor, with a light smoky impression. All perfectly matched. Super and strong beer!

Bottle. From notes.
Amber with a tan head.
Caramel, grass, some nuts, fruits, slightly roasted.
This is usually a nice choice with most kinds of food.

Sampler at CBF 2011-06-28. From bottle. Clear, sparkling copper with an off-white film. Dried fruits, tobacco in the aroma followed by fruity notes. Acidic and hoppy bitter flavors with a metallic hint. Medium body. Long bitter finish.

THOUGHTS: Might have been slightly skunked. Looked like a penny and tasted a little like one, too. Fairly well-balanced. Nice beer that may be incredible before it travels overseas to sit under fluorescent lights on a shelf for God-only-knows how long.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a copper that looked like a clean penny in the light and a dirty penny out of direct light. It had an average to large, off-white head that mostly diminished. When pouring in the bottom of the bottle there was small to medium particles in the body of a thick density. The aroma had moderate to heavy caramel; light to moderate grassy hops; toffee; brown sugar, and slight skunk. The initial flavor was moderately sweet and lightly bitter; while the finish was light to somewhat sweet and moderately bitter. There was a lot of caramel malt and then some metallic and grassy hops along with a little lemon and tea toward the finish. The medium body was fairly syrupy and then a little dry with fairly soft, yet slightly fizzy carbonation and a metallic and slightly chalky finish.

330 ml bottle.
Pours a dark copper colour with a white head. Aroma of vegetables and mild toasted malts. Flavour of toasted malts, strong toasted nuts and grassy hops. Medium bodied with a thick mouthfeel and a dry, nutty, slightly toasty finish. Good.

Light head, clear dark golden
nose with dark caramel, rye, dry and lightly fruity
some body and fine length
tsate is caramel with a light bitternes
very pleasant quaffing beer

Pours a dark amber color with a small beige head that leaves very little lacing. Slightly weak aromas of caramel, toffee and roasted nuts. Excellent malty flavors of dark fruit, toffee and bread. Chewy mouthfeel with a sweet malty finish. An impressive Vienna; one of the better ones Ive had.
Clear amber without head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and light hoppy. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and bitter finish. 120506

Bottle @ home. Hazy red/maroon appearance with a small off white head. Sweet caramel malty, slightly roasty, bready nose. Bready, quite sweet, a touch roasty, caramel malty flavor. Nothing too special.

Pours clear rubish amber with a bubby tanned head leaving nice lacing. Aroma is malty, molassis, roasted, hay, hoppy and bready. Big fullbodied malty mouhfeel. Excellent flavor; roasted, very malty, biscuits, caramel, a bit fruity. Well balanced, medium body. Finishes fruity sweet with nice tart aftertaste.

23-APR-2011, bottle @home, brought by Morten, from Systembolaget.
Mahogany, low (almost no) beige head.
Malty, fruity, and bock-like with bready stuff.
Very thin.
Very boring.

Bottle.  Pours an amber body with a white head.  Light hoppiness, earth, sazz, and floral tones.  Mildy sweet malty tones, caramel and light roasted malt tones.  Light toasted malt tones, a bit burnt and very bread y.  Average offering.
Draught. Dark amber colour. Mild aroma. Heavy bitterness. A bit spicy. A good beer.

Bottle. Clear chestnut mahogany colour with a dirt white head that leaves nice lacings. Aroma is malty with a buttery tone, a bit aquarium, and some hops. Reminds me of Jämtlands beers. Taste is malty, rich and quite sweet. Some hop action that, too bad, gives it a weedy sour feel. The carbonation is a bit fizzy. Body is a bit too weak. Damn, I remembered this as a much better beer. I might be off my feet today.

Doft: Bröd, papp och malt
Smak: Smakar mycket jord, korn och fruktansvärd mycket våt papp
Vätskan ger mig en mycket torr munkänsla.
Eftersmak: Lite bitterbesk och absolut inte rolig.

Bottle served in a lager glass. Pours orange-amber in color with a short khaki head. Basic retention and lacing. Bright, sweet aroma of raisin, caramel, barley, dense bread, and other malt notes. Could pass for a barley wine on the nose. Shocking! Medium sweet flavor. Not as big as the nose. Acting more like a vienna now. Still, nice quality here. Medium body, oily-thin texture, average carbonation, and a dry, bitter finish.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma hints of coffee and the roasted malts in the brew hints with their presence. Not much hops in the aroma though. Taste carries notes of coffee and a slight sweetness, it rounds off with a medium hoppiness. This is a nicely balanced brew that goes excellent with food.

aroma is an odd musty and dusty maltyness with biscuits, dough, plums and other dark fruit.
cloudy rusty dark orange, thin flimsy rocky offwhite head.
taste is surprisingly mellow, slightly sweet but bittersweet and slightly tart in the back
very thin, almost watery, but tasty sweet dried fruit finish. carbonation is lively but fine.
01.01.2011. 0,33l Bottle. Pale amber brow colour with white head.Malty aroma with sweetness and bitterness. Dry bitter aftertaste with aromatic hoppy finish
Light amber with a off-white head. Clean, fresh malt flavours of light caramel, toffee and bread, also some light spicy and citrusy hop notes providing a fresh counterpart. A very nice vienna.

Medium brown with a tan head that remains as a thin layer of foam.  Light lacing.  An aroma of fruit and caramel malt is simple but pleasant.  The flavor is pretty much the same.  Fruit is tangerine and peach.  It is somewhat sour.  Finish was just a bit thin.

Bottle.Pours amber with a small off-white head.Aroma of grains,bread and peachy,spicy,herbal hops.Flavor is fruity ,sweet malt,some toasted notes and hops.Nice firm bitterness,dry finish,average carbonation.Nice one.

Pours hazed amber brown with a foamy beige head that fades leaving spotty lacing. Aroma of molasses, dark fruit, roated grains, also some faded hops, could be a couple of yeasr old. Taste is smooth and mellow with dark fruit sweetness, roasted chocolate malts, some nut and molasses. Good balance of sweet and bitter, more flavor than most viennas and marzens.
33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma is bread, roasted malt and some smoky notes. Flavor is roasted malt, caramel + liquirice? Nice balance, not too sweet. Very enjoyable.
thin body, taste is mostly bitter, with some hints of roasted malts, dry bitter finish. An ok beer.
330ml bottle on a balkony i Lund. Hoppy, sweet, toasty, grassy, lovely aroma. Ok head, amber colour. Metallic bitterness, a bit too sweet and too bitter lowers my overall rating. C
Bottle. Brown colored with a nice light brown creamy head with lacings. Aroma is caramel, malt and mild hops. Flavors of nuts, caramel, malty and sweet. Decent brew.

Draught at Man in the Moon (Stochkolm).
Elegant aspect, bubbly and lively burnt red color. Optimal dense and creamy head of great duration. Slightly singed aroma with stumnotes, braced cereals and rost wood.

Bottle from Systembolaget.  Pours clear amber with a big frothy off-white head, which disappear fast. Malty fruity aromas. Thae taste is constructed around the powerful malts, sweet fruity caramel, supported by right amount of bitter hops. Really enjoyable this one.
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  Poured a light brown with light lacing.  Aroma was of cherry, caramel, and cinnamon.  Flavor was of lemon, pine, and grass.  Bitter lemon taste.

Bottle.  Poured with a moderately dark amber color, with a thin but firm pillowy head.  The aroma is a bit funky and almost sour.  This drinks with an interesting blend of flavors -- at first the caramel malt backbone of a classic fest beer, but then with a farmhouse-like wildness pops in.  (#3869, 3/27/2010)

Flaska 2009-04-09
Fruktig doften, fudge, bread. 
Citrus, krämig känsla. Kraftig efterbeska.
2nd November 2008. Clear brown beer made with rye. Nicely balanced malt and rye with the lightest touch of hop at the end. The rye aromatics lift this otherwise vanilla beer.

Bottle shared by akevitt.  Pours a hazy, orange-amber body with a light brown foam head.  Aroma of caramel malts, bread, and spices along with a hint of floral hops and maybe prunes.  Aroma is much better than the flavor, which is pretty one-dimensional and mainly bread/caramel malts.  Very watery on the palate.  Finishes clean with a slight burnt malt and coffee finish.

I like this a lot.The taste is something akin to a dunkle but orange amber in color like a Vienna only unfiltered and hazy and made w/ the use of caramel malt, which is not typical of either style, and roasted barley which is forbidden by the Reinheitsgebot. The nose is fantastic, mildly sweet and bursting w/ malt character and a faint dusting of either very fresh noble hops or a bit. The flavor is nearly so good w/ notes of chocolate and more malt nuances coming to the light as it warms slightly, all balanced by a mild hop presence. My one complaint is that the carbonation is overly mild, leading to the impression of wateriness which never suits any beer. Overall, this is simply a fantastic lager bier made somewhat close to several traditional styles w/o being a perfect match for any of them. This is one I intend to resample in the future. I can see myself being fived by this sucker if they ever make a small adjustment to the level of carbonation.

Bottle: &nbsp Deep amber, slight haze, minor frothy white head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Almost a slight smoked malt character, a little peat, otherwise low hop and carob. &nbsp Interesting take on the style. &nbsp Yeah, a touch 

smoked on the tongue, but not as malty as I would have thought. &nbsp A little bright on the finish, a touch of astringency. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate. &nbsp Finishes with a bit of aged hay/straw, a little barnish, with 

lingering bits of smoked/peat like malts. &nbsp Not bad, but wished it would be a bit sweeter.

New Years Day: Hazy unfiltered amber with a small rocky head and okay lace. The aroma has notes of caramel and roasted malts, snappy rye like vapours with a hint of Juniper, grassy and herbal hops, with a dash of chocolate plum. The taste is bready and has slight fruity notes with a hint of anise and grapefruit. A touch of band-aid and light bitterness. The mouth feel is sharp but moderately carbonated, a bit metallic as well. Nice display of different grains and hops but lack the robust character I wanted, in the end it almost seems dumbed down.

Pours a clear dark golden orange color with golden amber edges when held to a light source and a thin .5 finger off white head that immediately settles into a lasting ring. Not much lacing.

Very hoppy aroma for the style with hints of earthy dry pine as well as some toasted caramel malt.

Very hop forward with plenty of dry piny bitterness that lingers throughout. Caramel malt backbone provides a nice balance rather than being the prominent flavor which is very odd for the style. Spicy notes of cinnamon, pepper and brown sugar. Light bodied, clean and crisp with a dry bitter finish.

11.2 fl oz bottle purchased at Lukas KC. Pour is hazed copper brown with a one inch off white head. Nice lacing. Aroma of big straw grassy caramel maltiness, some fruit sweetness under that. A touch of nuttiness comes out when it warms. Taste is the nose, straw mild
caramel malt, hazelnut and the faint fruit sweetness. The taste is not quite as fresh and vibrant as the nose, but is still nice. Some interesting yeast thing going on with some clove and spice. Palate is low carbonation, thin to medium bodied. The mouthfell is actually a little oily and flat tasting, though is still reasonably easy to drink.

(bottle - 330 ml) Copper pour with a thin white head and lots of carbonation. Aroma is very malty and sweet with a lot of caramel notes. Flavor is similar. Smooth and sweet at the beginning with a mildly roasted malt middle. Some light bitterness and roasted caramel malts at the end. Light body and light aftertaste.
Som alltid med Nils Oscar, en öl som genomsyras av kvalitet. Ett hantverk som arbetats fram med stor kärlek, omsorg och sinne för detaljer.

(bottle) Orange color with some sediment. Burnt-caramel maltiness with subtle hoppiness underneath.  Chewy mouthfeel.  I did not have high expectations for this beer, but that was a mistake.  Its a nice, solid beer.  I would classify this as a table beer b/c of its relatively low alcohol content. However, it has the flavor of a higher-alcohol beer.
Ambet with white head - strong malty taste, hints of caramelsome roasted notes - distinct hoppy flavor - very nice and drinkable
Hazy brown with a white head.  Aroma is caramel and DMS.  It tastes as it smells with a mildly sour, grainy finish.  $2/11.2oz

Got this bottle a few months ago at Sams in Chicago; hasnt been kept  chilled. And perhaps it should have been. Think its gone bad as it has some definite sourness. Poured with a tan head that quickly subsided and no lace. Aroma is just plain malty beer. Color isnt that great - hazy medium to dark amber. Flavor is like aroma but yeasty bitter plus the sour. Body is ok and so is carbonation. Cant finish it tho.

330ml bottle.  Bready, lightly sweet, caramel aroma, very lightly fruity and spicy.  Cloudy medium-dark red-orange color, head is fine and lasting.  Flavor profile is nicely balanced between the caramel and sugary malt sweetness, background dried fruitiness, lightly spicy, herbal hop and moderate bitterness.  Lingering caramel malt flavors late.  Smoothly effervescent and thin on the palate with a light-medium body.  Quite  drinkable and a very good example of the style.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a medium sized head of foamy fine to medium sized bubbles that were and left behind a transparent softly carbonated golden and thick foamy lacing. The aroma was malty and bready. The crisp mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish hoppy aftertaste. The flavor contained notes of hops.
Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. The look is clear, golden to orange in color, with a white head.  The smell is caramel, wheat, sweet, cereal, and malts.  The taste is malts, sweet, wheat, very grainy.
Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Amber in color with a small off-white head. Aroma is of malt, toffee, cocoa, and caramel. Taste is of grain, caramel, toffee, and leaves.
(330ml bottle)  Pours an amber body with a small off-white head.  Aroma of apple, biscuit, and florals.  Flavor of nuts, apple, biscuit, grass, caramel, and toffee with a dry, bitter finish.

(330ml bottle thanks to bu11zeye) Pours a light translucent brown, good lacing. Nose is great, caramel, and sweet. Taste doesnt follow the nose in fact it has almost no sweetness at all, but bready and toasted grains. Carbonation is the best thing here, but again no sweetness lingering on the palette.
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  poured hazy amber with a white head.  aroma of caramel malt and dark fruits.  flavor was caramel, slight toasted grains.  light body with a slick feeling.
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  copper with an off white head.  nose is sweet caramel malts and dried fruits.  light on the palate with a very nice slightly sweet malt flavor.
Bottle courtesy of bu11zeye.  Clouded orange.  Big earth tones.  Sweet like a Belgian strong.  Dry bitter taste.  Easy but edges out bitter.

bottle. Pours an iced tea colored orange. Aroma is caramel malts, rye, light citrusy hops, nutty. Taste is toasty, malty sweetness with mild citrusy hop flavor in the finish. Smooth, extremely drinkable. Highly recommended

Mondial 2009.  Thought I coudlnt get this in the US, but now I realize I can- and I probably will.  Shit is good!!!!  Pours a nice deep coppery almsot amber with a nice lasting beige head.  Aroma is nutty good toasted malts, toffee, and fresh baked bread with hints of burnt edges.  Flavor is lightly hoppsy- herbal and slightly spicy, tons of bready biscuit malts, light toffee, and good fresh munichand hints of light burn and fresh herbal and floral hops.  Finsih is a lsight bit mineral and good clean bitterness- smooth.  Great Vienna.

Bottle shared with MrBunn. Strange aroma of Deep Woods Off and citronella...pours a light amber with moderate head. Taste is peculiar with an indistinguishable funk lightly rounded out by a bit of nuttiness..Light bitterness in the finish. Odd.
Bottle.  Pours a copper with a fluffy head and aromas of citronella and spice.  Flavor is a little weak at first and finishes with a crisp hoppiness. A little astrongency in the finish

text: dark amber, minimal head. very tasty. acrid, dry hops, sweet and thick. lots of caramel.

Bu au Mondial 2009, le 4 juin (#12). Ambrée miel, peu de collet. Arome dhoublon sec un peu sucrée. Goût dhoublon un peu sucré, beaucoup dorge, peu darrière-goût. Cétait bien mais elle était trop chaude!

Sampled at Hangar 24, thanks to Molly for bringing this back fro Sweden. This was somewhat dark gold in appereance. Light aroma, a little toasty if I remember correctly. Easy to drink, very nice little brew.
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: 11.2 oz bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy amber with a dense one finger off-white head that leaves spotty lacing.  The nose is bready and citrus hops with some malt.  The taste is malt, floral hops and some earthiness/grainy bread with a bitter grapefruit finish.  Medium mouthfeel.  Good stuff, not $6 a bottle good, but good nonetheless.

Aroma:sweet bread-caramel aroma...
Apperance:Clear amber good head...
Flavor:caramel,bread,good bitterness...

Poured an amber color with a thin white head.  Aroma was dark bread, heavy malt, really bready, lots of yeast.  Flavor was more of the same with a big full mouthfeel.  For all of that though, it was a little one dimensional.  Really kind of a non-sweet malt bomb.
Poured cloudy copper. Caramel and malt aroma. Creamy, buttery mouthfeel. Taste of buterscotch, caramel , fruit and earthy hops. Ver ynice.

Bottle. Clear copper colour with an off-white head. Aroma: Sweet malt/grain, caramel, bread, fruit, light smoke. Taste: Biscuity/bready malt, caramel, toffee, light smoke, hops/bitterness towards the finish.

33 cl bottle from Bieropholie, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. FE09/09.
App.:  Clear deep amber with a fair off-white froth.
  
Aroma:  Lots of sticky males, some fruitiness, brown sugar, dark dried fruits; a touch of pine/grapefruit hops.
  
Palate:  Medium body and effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Still lots of sticky malts, some fruitiness, a touch woody; off-dry with some bitterness.

Kalas-OK.

Yeah, definately wasnt worth the $5 with the $2 off because its Tuesday at the Brasserie. A marzen i can identify with, but just sub par overall in all areas. Poured a clear orange with a small white head. Aroma is noticeably malty, with biscuit and and hop on the nose as well. Taset is sort of tart midpalate. Grassy, slightly dry with hops firm hops in the finish.

In short: A caramelized beer with resinous hops with annoying meaty notes.
How: Bottle 330ml.  Consumed a few days after receiving it through private importation but it was already close to expiration date
The look: Clear redish-copper body topped by a very small off-white head
In long: Wet bread with old fruits (citrus mainly) and resinous hops.  Annoying red-meat sensation.  Strangely similar to their Nils Oscar Farm Ale that I had minutes before this one.  Like the Farm Ale but less dirty and with a boosted carbonation.  Certainly not what Im used to from a Vienna.  The beer has some qualities but the meaty character prevents it from being enjoyable.  Drinking it I was thinking to myself Wow, Im drinking a rare beer! and I wasnt thinking about the availability.

A very tasty Vienna. Aroma was so so. Mostly caramel malt with just a hint of biscuit. Pour was a nice light caramel color with a one finger off white head. Taste was delicious. It was (again) mostly caramel malt with a nice roasty character and a sweet malty aftertaste. Decent carbonation rounds this beer out. A little too sweet, but very full.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
Draught.
Pours dark amber with a big off white head.
Smells sweet of malt and caramell.
The body is a bit to thin.
This copper ale poured with a creamy off-white head and a rich caramel aroma. There is a carbonated caramel malt and bread flavor with smooth hop bitterness at the finish.

330ml bottle, amber copper color, with a frothy beige head, toasted, biscuity malt, cookie dough, fruity nose of ripe apples, with a light toffee, breadiness, with a faint nutty, caramel note, with a hint of brown sugar sweetness in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a toasty, caramel, grainy malt character, with a mild multi-grain, bready accent, with some smooth toffee, buttery malt flavors, with a light flowery hop spiciness, leading towards a mild malty, toasty, lingering hop bitterness finish. A nice interpretation of the vienna-marzen style.

Bottle: Poured a medium copper color with average foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of caramel malt with a dry hoppy finish. Taste is not the most complex but caramel malt are well done and the hops are clearly noticeable in the aftertaste. Full boy for the style with good carbonation. Well done and no distinguishable flaws but maybe lacking some character.

Brown bottle, 33 cl, best before 08 DEC, via Importations Privées Bièropholie, savoured on January 27 2009; eye: copper, clear, good effervescence made up of very fine bubbles, tan head that falls and turns into a tiny ring, good lacing; nose: slightly resinous fresh hops, slight caramel that becomes more and more present as the beer warms up, light dust; mouth: caramel malt, slightly resinous fresh hops, finale in caramel malt with a good presence of slightly resinous fresh hops, rather carbonated, medium body, mildly bitter, slightly sweet, rich texture, slight astringency; overall: nice surpise

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 33 cl, meilleure avant 08 DEC, via Importations Privées Bièropholie, savourée le 26 janvier 2009; il : bronze avec des reflets cuivrés, claire, légère effervescence, mousse crémeuse beige qui demeure, très légère dentelle; nez : cuivrée, claire, bonne effervescence composée de très fines bulles, mousse fauve qui tombe et se transforme en un petit anneau, bonne dentelle; bouche : malt caramel, houblon frais légèrement résineux, finale en malt caramel avec une bonne présence de houblon frais légèrement résineux, plutôt carbonatée, corps moyen, moyennement amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture riche, très légère astringence; en résumé : belle surprise

Verre de dégustation, provenant dune bouteille de 500 ml, dégusté au festival Flaveurs, Bières et Caprices 2008 (Montréal, QC). Arôme: Odeur de céréales avec une pointe dhoublons. Apparence: La couleur est dorée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales avec une pointe dhoublons et de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture chuileuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Présence de céréales en arrière goût. (Rating #2094)
Clear amber with large off white head. Sweet aroma with notes of hops, toasted malt and caramel. Sweet malty flavour with breadish, caramel and fruity notes. Finished mild bitter.

Bottle. Not as unusual as some of their beers by still a bit interesting. Dark orange appearance with a small head.Pleasant  but unusually mundane for this brewery.Or perhaps  I was in a grumpy mood when I tried it.

Bottle.  Red, brown with  a small head.  Aromas are woody, spicy and dry with nutty notes and some vinegar.  Flavours are sweet toffee malts with spicy, earthy hops.  Dry and woody with hints of fruit.  Good.

Orangish copper with an amber hue to it.  Small tan head.  Malty flavor with a dry finish.  I was impressed with this beer.  I just picked up the Nils Oscar Imperial Stout and cant wait to try that.  Good Scandanavian beer.
Bottle.  Brownish and reddish beer with a malty and rich aroma.  The flavour is rich and malty, mildly vinous and roasted. Overall a nice beer.

small, almost non existant off-white head. Ruby colour. Aroma of grapefruit, spices and sweet malt. Flavour is full of bread and a distinct hoppyness. There is almost some faint traces of smoke in the flavour too. A great vienna.

My Bottom Line:
Caramelized, bready malts remain crisp enough to build a sessionable and clean Vienna-style experience, while leafy hops brush its background efficiently.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam circles the clear, dark russet.
-Bitterness (and hop presence overall) is quite low. The finish remains quite dry though.
-Slight fruitiness roams throughout, but never bothers.
-This is not a memorable lager, but I’m sure it’s always a pleasant pint when you’re thirsty.

Bottle.

Pours a really pretty dark orange with an amber hue and a small frothy creamy beige head.   Aroma of lightly oxidized hops, crusty bread, very light sweetness.  Semi-sweet first taste that immediately turns very dry, bread crumbs, interesting hop spice, a bit bland.   Nice smooth body though...
Bottle 50cl. Amber/Orange/brown body with a small dense head. Caramel and malt in the nose. Rather sweet body with malt and hops as the dominating parts and a nice bitter finish. Nice beer!

Bottle from Systembolaget. Amber color with a small white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, slightly citrusy and grassy hops. Flavour is sweet and malty with some bitter, grassy hops att the end. Medium body, slightly thin texture and average carbonation with a decent bitter finish. Overall a nice lager.

Nice lager, a little smoke and edge from (toasted) rye, nice smooth drinking, even creamish. Good white head on a shade of yellow. Neutral aroma. Satisfying though drying aftertaste.Good drinkability.Good balance as sweetness in there and moderate hops.

Pours a golden amber color with an off-white head. Sweet and light aroma of caramel malt and grassy hops. Refreshing sweet malty flavor of caramel and bread with a hint of fruit. Very well balanced with a medium hop-bitterness. A pleasant beer inspired from Märzen and Festbier.

Picked this up from Beer Merchants, Cave Direct, cheers Phil L Had this outside Frank (Camper) in campsite by the sea 17-09-08   Pours amber with white head. Nice toffee and malt flavours in fact quite toffee appleish, nicely bitter in the right places. Not too sweet, some vanilla fudge on nose, really decent beer.

(Draught at Pikkulintu, Helsinki, on 2008-09-26) Copper red. Clear. Largish quickly disappearing white head. Malty nose. Full bodied and dryish palate with lot of carbonation. Malts, roastedness, bitterness and hint of sweetness in taste. Bitterness in aftertaste that lasts quite long.

Slightly hazy bronzy orange with small but lacy whitish head. Aroma is a bit toffy, caramel malty with some grassy hoppyness. Sweet, much malty and slightly roasty, bready flavor with OK hoppy finish. Medium-bodied and oily palate. A pleasant refreshing brew but no specialty.

Bottle from Beertopia. Poured clear dark copper color with an average frothy off-white head that mostly lasted and produced excellent to good lacing. Moderate roasted bread aroma. Medium body. Moderate to heavy bittersweet flavor with medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. The beer goes well with spicy food.

330 mL bottle.  Copper-orange with a small, short-lived head.  The aroma, is appealing and complex, containing some fresh fruit (peaches, apples), a touch of chocolate, sweetish malt, and some earthy hops.  The fruit drop out of the flavour, and the hops step up.  Crisp, slightly bitter finish.  A very good beer.

Bottle. Medium sized ivory head that  mostly diminished, fair amount of lacing, transparent, visible carbonation, and an orange hue. The aroma was malt, bready, toasty, caramel, notes of chocolate, nutty, and sweet. The flavor was malty, caramel, chocolate notes, bready, nutty, and a short dry finish. The mouthfeel was mildly tingly and this beer is medium bodied. While this is not a beer that will knock your socks off, it is a very easy to drink beer, good for the style, nice mouthfeel, worthy of a try, and has a nice flavor. I would revisit this beer again if it came my way.
75 characters about this beer??...hmm..ok I make a try: "I have to drink this one again absolutely". Hope thats enough.....

7-20-08 bottle 
Orange amber clear with a decent off white head.  Smell is light and doughy and sweet, very light overall.  Flavor is slightly bitter and hoppy citris.  Not heavy or too bold but super drinkable and enjoyable.  Overall, a very sharp and clean flavor.  Nice well fitting mouthfeel.  One of the better or perhaps the best Nils Oscar beers I have tried.

Pours a very slightly hazy amber with a small white filmy head.  Smell is slightly funky, toasty malt.  Taste is crisp hoppiness up front followed by a nice smooth toasty sweetness that is pretty nice.  Nice fairly full mouthfeel with prickly carbonation.  Much better than I was expecting.  Nicely bittered to balance and a flavorful maltiness.  Really, a pretty good beer.

Bottle.  Nose sweet and citric with pale and caramel malt, nice musty hops.  Deep copper-orange pour with a densely rocky yellow-beige head.  
Crisp and lightly bitter taste
caramel and roast grain with light smoke, subtle lemony citrus sneaking in with those musty hops, faint toffee in the bg.  Touch of grapefruit, a little dust and grain.  Lightly spicy, bready, with both featuring prominently in the very dry aftertaste.  Medium / slightly lighter body.  Deliciously earthy - a lot to like here!
Bottle. Amber colour with a medium white head. Dark fruits and caramel in aroma. Flavour is tons of caramel and toffee with a touch of grain. Great mouthfeel. Good beer.

From a 500ml bottle shared by badgerben, pours a reddish copper amber brew with a thin off-white head that quickly dissipates to a fine film. Aroma of sweet caramel malt, light dark fruits, a touch of flowery hops and  roasted nuts. Taste is medium bodied, lightly carbonated with flavors of sweet caramel and multi-grain malt, a touch of toffee and flowery hops. Finish has a nice sweet malty aftertaste that even brings for some herbal spice added.

Copper color with a thin head.  Strong Munich malt aroma, bread and grain.  Grainy flavor.  Lots of fresh grain, like gnawing on a barley field in September.  No hop flavor at all.  Not stunning, but very solid and great for the style.
Amber colored, moderate head, solid lacing and retention. Aroma is grass, caramel, earth. Medium to light bodied, very drinkable.

Slightly hazy, reddish amber appearance with a small, off white head.  Malty, sweet  aroma.  Earthy, malty, grainy (rye, maybe), spicy, decently hopped taste, with the sweetness of the aroma no longer evident.  Bitter, medium bodied mouthfeel, leading to a lingering finish.  Very flavorful.

Bottle poured a clear amber with a small lasting light amber head. Aromas of carmel, graininess, spice, light brown sugar and light citrus. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of carmel, spice and light brown sugar with a smooth malty finish.

Dark brown colour with ruby notes, foamy off-white head. Sweetish, caramelly and slightly toasty aroma. Sweet fruity flavors with notes of malts and caramel. Perfectly hopped and well balanced vienna.

delicious strong aroma, dark fruits , citrups, hops. clear dark yellow with large lasting off-white head. Flavor : fantastic. ipa style , but somewhat underplayed and thus extremely drinkable. well balanced, i cant figure what it tastes like, but it is very very good. both appearance and palate is like 3.49 or so, but ill add one in overall to compensate. If You like non-extreme IPA style beers with a clear micro/quality taste, this one is fantastic.
Bitter roasted malt flavors.  Medium palate with light brown colors.  Pretty good.

11.2 oz. brown bottle. No freshness date seen. Poured out a deep amber color, with a minuscule tan head. Aromas are of sweet malts, slight caramel, earthy hops. Flavors are chalky malts, slight sweetness, not much else. A mediocre beer at best.
Bottle. Really nice red/brown color. Aroma is bready with some smokey notes.  Flavor is nutty,malty,bready and finishes with a fresh bitter hop taste.

Bottle shared by Blake.  Clear amber body, not much head.  Nutty, malty aroma.  The flavor really picks it up because of unripened-fruit bitter hopping, and a clean, firm maltiness.  A very solid beer.  Clean & well executed.

Pours to a clean orange body with a thin creamy white head.  The aroma is grainy with a subtle butterscotch.  Grain dusts.  The flavor is nutty with some peanuts and filberts.  Nice grain bed flavor.  The palate is lightly astringent with a malty mouthfeel.  A good fest beer.

So Kalasol means Vienna.  This is a good beer.  Pours clear copper with a firm white head.  Crisp aroma of honey, oranges, corn, herbs, and rye bread.  Light caramel malt with tart peppery Saaz hops and a mild cirtus taste blended together.  Nothing overpowers, leaving a clean taste and finish.

33 cl. Clear darkish copper with a three-finger head that leaves crunchy lace. Earthy orange, honey, grain and slight chocolate and corn aromas. Taste is caramel, cocoa, earthy grain, molasses, toasted nut, and resin. Also some light corn, grass, citrus, and occasional gunmetal. Medium body is mostly smooth, and finishes dry. This one and the Brooklyn Lager beat the heck out of Eliot Ness, as far as tasty Viennas.

Bottle. Pours deep amber with small white head. Aroma is thick grains, some caramel, light toast, very slight grassy bitterness. Flavor is round, mildly burnt, caramel maltiness, delicate herbal bitterness, finishes  with some bitterness. A very nice beer, tastes like something traditional in northern europe, which I really appreciate.

Bottle. HogTownHarry just rated this and convinced me to as well -- so here we go! Pours a clear deep amber with an average size diminishing white head. Nice aroma of caramel malt, some toastiness, light chocolate, light herbal hops, nuts and earthiness. Toasted caramel malt flavour along with cocoa, nuts, earthy hops and an average bitter finish. Average to medium bodied. Very good stuff, I want more!

Bottle.  Clear fairly deep amber pour, ldecent solid creamy-fizzy off-white head.  Nice fresh roast grain aroma, quite oily and lightly herbal bitterness.   Plenty of roast in the flavour too - cereal and a bit of bitter cocoa, maybe a touch of metal up front, but waves of dry herbal bitterness .... chewy body, lively mouthfeel, bitter and minerally in the long finish - quite good!
Bottle. Amber/copper colour with white head. Nose is hops, malt. Flavor is malt, light caramel and bitterness. Good beer.
Toasty, crisp - some nuttiness.  Some notes of rye in the finish, though very subtle.  This was probably the best of the 4 Nils Oscar beers we tried tonight (IPA, Imp. Stout, Bwine and this).

330ml Bottle (Olutkellari, Helsinki) - Copper coloured witth a malty aroma along with some sweetness and some roasted notes. Malty taste with a bit of caramel and chocolate and a subtle hoppiness. Nicely balanced

Bottle 0.5 l. Bought Superbrugsen Ulleroed. Colour clear dark amber with small beige head. Aroma different hops and malt. Taste perfectly bitter obtained by a mixture of Fuggles, cascade and Saaz hops contrasted with the sweetness from the malts - especially the caramel is dominant. What a vienna!

From Julios Liqour in Mass.  Pours with an amber body topped by a thin to medium thick, off-white head with some lacing.  Its slightly sweet and bready with a nice underlying grass and grapefruit hoppiness.  Medium bodied and smooth yet dry.

330ml bottle (Olutkellari, Helsinki)
Sweet malty aroma, some ginger, some wet sheep. Lively palate, not fizzy as such. Quite full flavoured. Strongly hoppy and pretty malty too, quite well balanced, nutty in places. Long malty and nutty finish.

11.2oz bottle.  Pours a coppery dark amber with a firm off-white head.  Aroma is sweet and malty, with scents of syrupy hops, caramel, roasted malt, and floral notes.  Taste is light and crisp, with a flavor of caramel, dark fruit, and syrupy hops giving way to a dry finish of roasted malt.  Light but full-flavored -- delicious brew.

Bright copper color with a moderate fluffy beige head. Earthy caramel and lightly toasted malt aromas. HInts of floral/herbal hops. Crisp and clean form the start. With Light caramel, light herbal hops and a hint light fruit. Fell is just right for style with light and not quite zippy lift. A dry lightly nutty finish and linger.

Bottle. Rich copper amber beer with an off-white head. Rye and caramel malt aroma. Sweet malt flavorwith a bit of chocolate and rye and enough hops to back. Medium body. Dark malt, grains, rye, and some hops linger.
bottle from pizza port.  Clear orange with a fizzy white head.  Sweet honey wheat bread aroma and taste with some earthy notes.

Bottle 330 ml  
Appearance: Neat shade of amber, medium light white ring  .Nose : Slightly nutty paired with sweet rich malts , rye bread . Pleasantly well exposed to taster. Light zesty hops on side7+ Flavor/Palate : Medium light bodied soft in character nutty , hazelnuts like theme . Light , refreshing and very drinkable. Subtle quality is apparent. Satisfying old school.

Aroma has chocolate? roasted malt, some fine hops too, copper, with a small toffee head. Flavour is a very rich malt, some good hops backing, and again chocolate is noted.Medium bodied, quite well balanced,  a treat on the tongue. Terrific!

Dark copper colored body with a thin, white head. The aroma is rich with caramel and fall leaves. There is also some pie crust and toasted notes. The taste is toasted almonds with some earthy orange peels. There is also some hints of raisins. Farily highly carboanted. A nicely made beer.

330ml bottle, blue cap.  Pours clear, deep copper color, thin white rocky head.  Big rye  aromas.  Smells of floral, grassy hops as well.  Flavor of spicy rye malt.  Balanced very well with a pleasant sharp hop bitterness.  Very well rounded lager.

From Superbrugsen, Aarhus
Bottled
Nice orange-red colour.
Notes of fruit and caramel
From a bottle--Poured a burnt copper body wtih some amber tones.  Nose of sticky, sweet hops and malts.  Floral and crisp.  The flavor revealed the roasty rye and some gritty malts.  Very nice beer.
Amber with a fine head. Perfumed and bitter aroma with a very nice flavour of orange, caramel and bread. It is extremely refreshing and by far one of the best viennas I have ever tried.

My first Swede. Nice, tight package. Some fruit, notes of rye,  Pour is clear orange/amber. Very refreshing. Clean crisp beer with enough malt to keep you interested and a snappy hops finish. For some reason I thought of Bisquick. Yum.

a hoppy dry malty and slight fruity amber beer.
dry caramel and hoppy flavour with crisp and hoppy finish. near perfect palate.

Bottle from Marilibusi in our first trade, a bonus bottle mind you.  Shared wtih my girlfriend Cyn pre 1200 night.  Pours orange witha  nice big 3 finger tan head.  Nose is sweet with toffe notes.  Taste is sweet, bitter, biscuity.  This is an interesting style and a complex brew.

A vigorous pour yields a three-finger thick, pale tan colored head.  The beer is an amber color that shows a brilliantly clear, deeply reddish hued, copper color when held up to the light.  The aroma is a nice mix of dry & sweet malt notes and a touch of spicy hop character.  Ample toasty malt, biscuit notes and bread crust aromatics mix in with notes of caramelized malt sugars, and a soft, berry like fruitiness.  The hops seem to accent the berry notes as well as provide a touch of herbal character.  This is most definitely a malt dominated beer, but I like the mix of malt notes here and the hops add just a little something to the aroma.

Quite spicy tasting, much more so than the aroma would have suggested; the beer has notes of grassy herbs, woody black pepper and an underlying spicy herbal note that is quite noticeable throughout each sip but most noticed up front..  This is still a substantially malt driven brew though as flavors of toasted biscuits, toasted whole grain bread, browned soda crackers and lots of spicy rye notes.  This has a light grain / malt sweetness to it that is a touch caramelized in character.  That berry note is here in the flavor too and still seems to be derived from a mix of malt and hop notes.  This has a light-medium heft to it that keeps this from being a beer you could pound.  It is a touch viscous and this really adds a nice texture, which in combination with the grain makes this a chewy brew.

This beer is quite spicy, I think this is driven by both the hops and the rye, either way it makes this beer quite interesting.  One of the tastier O-fest beers I have had in a while and even though the rye is non-traditional, I really like its addition to this brew.

Purchased: <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Tucson AZ
Transparent golden amber with minimal head and lacing.  The brew possesses toffee, buttermilk biscuit, and herbal notes.  Love the backstory here.  Just wish they made better beer.
A light amber color plenty of off-white head.  Sweet biscuit malts on the aroma with a faint citrus tinge.  Light malty body with a biscuit character to it and a faint hop bite on the finish.

Pours amber with a tall, semi spritzy froth. Good head retention reducing to a full dusty canopy leaving snail tracks down the glass. Aromas of caramel malted biscuits. Nice! Medium nectar with ample residual effers creating a soft cottony texture. Bright and crisp, this brew is alive. Well integrated flavors of caramel, citrus peel, biscuits, herbs, and a bit of mineral. The finish lingers with perfect bittering. Highly recommended.
Pours darker amber with a soft khaki head. Toasty malts up front, caramel and sweet bread. Finish is earthy, solid hops to ease up the malts.
330 ml bottle. Beautiful clear, golden amber body with a medium beige head. Lovely aroma of caramel malt. Flavor is malty, caramel and harmonic sweet/bitter. Fine finish. Nice, tasty and quaffable.

Bottle. Amber pour with one finger off white head. Alot of carbonation. A mild malt and hop aroma. Caramel malt taste with spice and smoke. Dry bitter finish. Not too much going on here it was just ok for me.

Bottle from SL, complete train wreck. Pour was deep full amber-orange-ish type deal, completely busted head. The aroma was grassy, earthy, dirt-like, stale vegetables almost. Flavor followed the aroma, sweet caramel playing against the earthy, grassy, dirt-like character, nuts also in the background. A very unpleasing experience from a style that is often enjoyable. Dont even want to know what I paid for this.

Pours a five finger light tan head that fades slowly to a thin layer leaving some lace. Crystal clear amber color. Medium carbonation and light-medium bodied. Hoppy nose. Flavor is mostly hoppy with malt and occasional sweetness, smooth. Slight lingering bitter aftertaste. $4.99 for a 330ml bottle from Johns Marketplace Portland, OR. Label has the ABV at 13.1%.

Pours a clear and good looking amber with a thin line of crème head. Nose is almost like a syrup. Flavor is robust with a leafy start, but it seems to get over-taken by a tone that is just too sweet and tangy to appreciate. Unbalanced. Feel is decent on the liquid and the carbonation is nice too. Decent. Seems a bit unbalanced though and that detracts.

Pours a transparent copper orange with a thin, spotty-lacing white head.  Aroma of toasty grainy caramel malts with authentic noble hop balance.  Starts lightly sweet with some earthy toasty grain and nutty notes and a hint of light fruity tartness toward a drier finish.  A pretty true to style Vienna, but could use a little more sweetness and less tartness.

Name: Kalasol
Date: 01/11/2008
Mode: Bottle
Source: Greens, Atlanta

clear dark copper, frothy off white head, 
sweet bready caramel malt aroma with floral hops, 
sweet malt flavor, lots of bready character, nice earthyness for balance, light bitterness in the finish

(33cl bottle) Crystal clear deep amber body topped by small off-white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, grapefruit, caramel, some bread.  Taste is medium sweet, grapefruit, caramel, some bread, spicy.  Somewhat dry finish with some duskiness.  Light-medium body.  An APA-ish Vienna.

330ml Bottle:  Aroma of malts, hops, caramel, butter, and grains.  Poured amber in color with a small off-white head that diminished quickly.  Clear.  Sparkling.  Flavor is very malty.  Tastes of malts, nuts, and caramel.  Medium body.  Tingly texture.  Average carbonation.  Malty, salty finish.  Very malty.

Warm caramel malt aroma. Amber color with an ephemeral white head. Medium in body with mild carbonation. The flavor is roasted caramel with spicey hop. Something like an ESB, actually. The finish is well balanced with a decent amount of bitter. Its a very tasty drink.

Bottle. Light amber colour with mostly diminishing off-white head. Malt, hops and some corn in the aroma. Flavor add green hops and a hint of caramel. Average finish - primarily hoppy. Well made Vienna.

Deep amber with rust red hues, sparse microscopic carbonation holds up a wispy, bubble-clustered off-white head. the body is crystalline and sullen. The nose is a rolling stew of caramelized breadcrumbs and grains with soft sugars and air-dried apples. Awkward tropical fruit esters are noteworthy. Breadiness is rustic and encompasses all other nuances in a rigid coccoon. The flavor is moderately bitter and lightly astringent, the grassy hops playing a pleasant role of spicing and livening things up a good deal. Sweetness is medium and thoroughly enjoyable, even as it gains momentum into the grassy, mildly bitter and toasty finish. The mouthfeel is lightly and evenly carbonated, very lightly sticky and prickly and is very easy to drink. A very good interpretation of a style that is very difficult to create a memorable version of.

Pours a pure, copper color.  Very little head.  Aroma is delicate, but vibrant.  Very malty and grainy, with a hint of spiciness, I am guessing that is from the rye.   Slight hop component on the finish.  Immenently drinkable.
Bottle, a few months past expiry date. Pours dark copper colour with no head to speak of. Pleasant aroma and taste with a slight metallic twang, though.

hazy amber with a thin off-white head.  aromas of burnt caramel, toast, and red apples.  flavors are nice with toast, burnt caramel, and bitter ashes.  palate seems a little thin.  light, dry finish.  its decent.
An interesting brew. Mild and malty with a special hoppiness. Some roasted notes as well .

Good looking pour, having a clear body the color of a new penny and a tall off-white head that laces heavily.  The aroma has some sweet floral hops and a splash of caramel.  The flavor has an even balance between fresh white bread & caramel and moderately bitter floral hops.  Quite quaffable.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Lakeview Liquors, Chicago, IL<font size=-1>
Pours bright amber into a Lager glass.  Off-white head recedes rapidly to skim surface.  Malty aromas.  Crisp and dry with upfront caramel and an abrupt finish.  Refreshing.
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is amber. Aroma is rich with hops and also caramel. Taste is hoppy. Good bittersweet finish.

Appearance: Pours a clear, dark amber body with a foamy, bubbly white head.

Smell: Aromatic toasted grain nose with notes of caramelized sugar, flowers, and citrus.

Taste: Sweet, sugar-encrusted grain flavor with a bit of toasted nuts. Hint of flowers. Candied citrus rind with a gentle bitterness. Dry finish with a mild, lingering bitterness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation. Slight stickiness to the mouthfeel.

Drinkability: A fine beer thats very drinkable, though, sadly, at $5.10 for a single 11.2oz bottle, its a beer experience I dont see myself often repeating.

11.2oz bottle. Poured a medium and clear orange/amber color with a larger sized off white head. Aromas of nuts, caramel, toasted malts, and grains. Tastes of caramel, some nuts, and some toasted malts. Somewhat sugary sweet.
Bottle. Amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of mlr, hops, fruit and caramel.

Bottle from Capones.  Medium copper pour with aroma of caramel malt, honey, apricot, slight nuts.  Tastes caramel malty, with mild hops, brown sugar, and nuts.  Pretty rich palate with decent complexity.
